name: traefik-log-dashboard
description: traefik-log-dashboard is a self-hosted interface to parse and visualize Traefik logs. It transforms logs into charts and tables to help analyze traffic patterns, errors, and backend performance.
features: Log parsing: Parse Traefik access logs automatically to extract meaningful metrics and insights.
Traffic visualization: View traffic patterns with charts showing requests over time, status codes, and response times.
Error analysis: Identify and analyze errors with breakdowns by status code, endpoint, and frequency.
Performance metrics: Monitor backend response times and identify slow endpoints or performance issues.
Top endpoints: See which routes receive the most traffic and which generate the most errors.
Client analysis: Analyze traffic by client IP, user agent, or geographic location for usage insights.
Time-based filtering: Filter logs by date range to focus on specific time periods or incidents.
Status code breakdown: View distribution of HTTP status codes to understand request success rates.
Backend performance: Compare performance across different backend services to identify bottlenecks.
Real-time updates: See new log entries and updated statistics as Traefik processes requests.
Export reports: Export charts and data for sharing or inclusion in reports and documentation.
Custom queries: Filter logs using custom criteria to answer specific questions about traffic patterns.
